<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><Highlight kind="comment">/// canAddPseudoFlagDep - For A9 (and other out-of-order) implementations,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the &#39;s&#39; 16-bit instruction partially update CPSR. Abort the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><Highlight kind="comment">/// transformation to avoid adding false dependency on last CPSR setting</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instruction which hurts the ability for out-of-order execution engine</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to do register renaming magic.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This function checks if there is a read-of-write dependency between the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><Highlight kind="comment">/// last instruction that defines the CPSR and the current instruction. If there</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><Highlight kind="comment">/// is, then there is no harm done since the instruction cannot be retired</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><Highlight kind="comment">/// before the CPSR setting instruction anyway.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Note, we are not doing full dependency analysis here for the sake of compile</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><Highlight kind="comment">/// time. We&#39;re not looking for cases like:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><Highlight kind="comment">/// r0 = muls ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><Highlight kind="comment">/// r1 = add.w r0, ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><Highlight kind="comment">///    = mul.w r1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><Highlight kind="comment">/// In this case it would have been ok to narrow the mul.w to muls since there</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><Highlight kind="comment">/// are indirect RAW dependency between the muls and the mul.w</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><Highlight kind="normal">Thumb2SizeReduce::canAddPseudoFlagDep(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> FirstInSelfLoop) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Disable the check for -Oz (aka OptimizeForSizeHarder).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (MinimizeSize || !STI-&gt;avoidCPSRPartialUpdate())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!CPSRDef)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If this BB loops back to itself, conservatively avoid narrowing the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// first instruction that does partial flag update.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> HighLatencyCPSR || FirstInSelfLoop;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// tMOVi8 usually doesn&#39;t start long dependency chains, and there are a lot</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
